prose: Marianne is a **woman** who works in a large office **place**. To **walk** means to move by putting one foot in front of the other. She **walked** through a long hallway to a heavy **door**. To **know** something is to have information in your mind. She **knows** all the rules. A guard said, "The Préfète is in session. Protocol is required." To **think** is to use your mind. Marianne had to **think** about what to do next. To **need** something is to require it. She **needed** to deliver her papers. To **use** something is to put it to work for a purpose. She would **use** the antechamber to wait. To **see** is to use your eyes. She **saw** another agent who said, "Ah, my compatriot. Your dossier shows no recent... complications. Good." To **help** is to make something easier. He did not **help** her. To **let** someone do something is to allow it. He would not **let** her pass. "You should reconsider your position before your dossier is... amended," he warned. To **feel** is to experience a sensation. She began to **feel** nervous. To **keep** something is to continue having it. She must **keep** her papers safe. To **run** is to move fast using your legs, but she could not **run** here. To **leave** is to go away from a place. She decided to **leave** and come back later. To **take** is to get hold of something. She would **take** her forms. To **give** is to hand something to someone. She would **give** them to the clerk tomorrow. The clerk often said, "Mind your paperwork." **Now** means at this moment. **Now** she must go. It is **good** to follow the rules, as **good** means of high quality. Her **long** day was over, and **long** means having great length.

Marianne **walked** to the café. To **walk** means to move by putting one foot in front of the other. She **wanted** a new **thing**. To **want** is to wish for something. A guard said, **"I'm afraid the regulations don't permit that."** She **needed** to **find** her papers. To **need** is to require something. To **find** is to discover something. She saw a **big** door. **Big** means large in size. A clerk inside said, **"Welcome to La Bourse Abondante. Your account is open."** He told her to **wait**. To **wait** is to stay in one place. She heard a **call**. To **call** is to speak loudly. A man yelled, **"The café awaits!"** She **felt** nervous. To **feel** is to experience an emotion. She **knew** she must **run**. To **know** is to have information. To **run** is to move fast using your legs. She **tried** to **come** back at **night**. To **try** is to make an effort. To **come** is to move toward something. **Night** is the dark time after the sun goes down. An inspector was not **happy**. **Happy** means feeling joy. He said, **"You should reconsider your position before your dossier is... amended."** He **looked** at her. To **look** is to direct your eyes. **"Mind your paperwork, Marianne,"** he said. She **took** a form. To **take** is to get hold of something. She must **make** a plan. To **make** is to create something. **First**, she would **help** her friend. **First** means before all others. To **help** is to make something easier for someone.

In the **world**, which means the earth and everyone on it, there are many **different** places, or locations. In one **old** place, an agent had a task. He **needed**, or required, to **find** one soul from each region. He **walked**, meaning he moved by putting one foot in front of the other, to **ask**, or request, for help. A clerk said, "The Préfète is in session. Protocol is required." He had to **wait still**, which means to continue **waiting** without moving. Later, he **came**, or moved toward, the Archivist. The Archivist told him, "I see you have served other bureaus, and now you **come** to serve mine." To **tell** is to give information with words. The Archivist **told** him, "My department requires a divination. For this, we **need** souls." He gave the agent a form. To **take** a form is to get hold of it. The agent **took** it. He **knew**, or had the information, he must not **run**, or move fast using his legs, **here** in this place. He must **walk**. In a **different** room, he heard, "Shhh... we're auditing the ledgers." He **looked**, meaning he directed his eyes, at them. One worker said, "The terroir **here** is... tense." The agent **left**, or went away from, that room. Outside, a guard **yelled**, "Take your irregularities elsewhere!" The agent **needed** **help**, which is to make things easier, to fix his papers. He would **come** back another **day**, when the sun is up.

Leo was a **child** who needed to **find** his way home. He had to **walk** a **long** road. He did not **know** the path, so he had to **look** at a map. To **look** means to direct your eyes at something. He did not **want** to be **wrong**. **Wrong** means not correct. He saw a guard who said, "Your face is in the files again." Leo felt **sad**. **Sad** means feeling sorrow. He asked the guard for **help**. To **help** is to make something easier for someone.

The guard said, "If you wish to petition her, please return during these hours." Leo did not have **money**. **Money** is what you use to buy things. He needed **food**. **Food** is what you eat to stay alive. He saw a shopkeeper who said, "Welcome to La Bourse Abondante. Your account is open." The shopkeeper would **give** him bread. To **give** is to hand something to someone. But first, Leo had to **run** an errand. To **run** is to move fast using your legs.

A tall clerk told him, "My department requires a divination. For this, we need souls." This made Leo **angry**. **Angry** means feeling mad. He did not **want** to do this task. He decided to **make** a plan. To **make** is to create something. He would **use** his map. To **use** is to put something to work for a purpose. Another agent told him, "Move. The Hexagon requires those dossiers be... closed." This was a **great** clue. **Great** means very good or important.

He **walked** to the correct office. A woman said, "Your service has been noted, and I am satisfied. I grant you this — the Dossier Infini." She would **show** him the way home. To **show** is to make something visible. Leo was happy. He had **found** help.
